newsitem.title: ITALY: De Benedetti cleared in Olivetti probe.
newsitem.headline: De Benedetti cleared in Olivetti probe.

text.p: Carlo De Benedetti, former chairman of Italian hi-tech group Olivetti, was cleared of tax fraud on Monday in a preliminary inquiry into alleged dividend stripping at the group in the period 1988-1992, judicial sources said.

Preliminary investigating judge Emanuela Gai, presiding over the court hearing in Ivrea, Olivetti's headquarters near Turin, aquitted De Benedetti and other senior managers of the group on the grounds that they had no case to answer.
De Benedetti, who quit as Olivetti chairman last September and has other graft cases pending, was accused with others of swindle and tax fraud in the inquiry which began four years ago.
So-called dividend stripping is a complex financial operation whereby companies attempt to avoid paying tax by transferring share dividends.
